title: Textile, early 18th century
medium:
Medium: wool embroidery on linen and cotton foundation
Technique: embroidered on plain weave
creditline: Museum purchase from Au Panier Fleuri Fund
description: Vertical panel of crewel embroidery with a large-scale pattern of baroque twisted columns on high bases with crossed palms entwined with large-lobed leaves; twining branches and similar leaves fill space between. Embroidered in wool yarns in shades of brown, blue, and blue-green, on an undyed linen and cotton ground.

tombstone.epitaph:
Textile, early 18th century.
early 18th century. Medium: wool embroidery on linen and cotton foundation
Technique: embroidered on plain weave. Museum purchase from Au Panier Fleuri Fund. 1955-144-2.
